IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Our goal is to help children reach their full potential and provide access to quality programs and services that make a difference to a child, their family, and the entire community.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Sierra Vista Child & Family Services (SVCFS) is a non-profit community based organization providing services for children, youth, adults, and families since 1972 to over 16,000 children and families yearly. The agency provides an extensive continuum of programs including community-based Family Resource Centers, mental health counseling and consultation, case management, parent education, child abuse prevention and intervention, domestic violence counseling, non-public and public school services, perinatal substance abuse services, and foster care and adoption. SVCFS is located in Stanislaus County with an additional office in Merced County. Our mission is to assist children, youth, and adults by empowering and supporting them in becoming stronger and healthier individuals, families and communities.
IRS990.Desc: SVCFS operates a non-public school that accepts children diagnosed as severely disturbed who qualify for this level of educational placement. The program provides full academic assessment, specialized curriculum for learning disabilities, vocational education, crisis intervention, an activity program, and family counseling. There is no cost to the families of children in this program. The school district and the Special Education Local Planning Area in which the student resides fund placements in Sierra Vista's Non-Public Schools. The average enrollment during the year was 68 students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SVCFS ICS team provides services based on the Stanislaus County Core Treatment Model (CTM). Services incorporate community collaboration, cultural competence, client/family driven services, a focus on wellness, and integrated services. Services provided by the Intensive Community Support Program approximated 8,409 hours. ICS levels of service include the core treatment services and are provided in outpatient settings. Clients at this level of care require intensive treatment services weekly.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SVCFS operates two Short-Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) Group Homes for children ages six to fourteen that struggle in regular foster care or in-home placements. The homes are located in clean, safe and family oriented neighborhoods in Modesto, California and are staffed with caring, nurturing and highly trained staff that ensure these children receive the most current, therapeutic and behavioral interventions. The goal of these homes is to assist the client in developing skills that promote socially appropriate functioning in the family, community, and academic setting, and to transition them to a lower level of care as soon as possible.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: SVCFS offers a number of other services. These include First Step Perinatal, Family Reunification, Child Abuse & Domestic Violence Prevention programs, Foster Family Treatment, an Intensive Care Foster Family program, and adoption services as well as various other counseling programs. Sierra Vista has Family Resource Centers operating at 5 locations in Stanislaus County. Funding for the above programs is provided by Behavioral Health and Recovery Services, Community Services Agency, Children's and Families Commission, participant fees, fundraising and donated dollars.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's endowment funds are held at Stanislaus Community Foundation, with investments in Community Capacity Building, Civic Engagement, and Education of the community.

Sierra Vista is exempt from taxation under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3) and California Revenue and Taxation Code Section 23701d. Generally accepted accounting principles provide accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an organization in its tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken by Sierra Vista in their federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. Sierra Vista's returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three and four years, respectively, after they are filed.
Nondiscriminatory policy is included in all advertisements and it is included in our enrollment materials.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Food and nutrition services to support the health and well-being of our clients.
Direct assistance for those in need of support.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: Adopt a Family, Scholarships and infant supplement
GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Financial needs for community members who needed additional support to maintain their family.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization maintains records to substantiate the amount of grants or assistance given and the selection criteria to award the grants.
The number of contributions is based on the count of donations by individuals during the reporting period.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is reviewed and approved by Audit/Finance Committee. It is then provided to all board members for approval.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Any known conflicts would be reviewed yearly by Board of Directors and Key Employees. Board members sign a conflict of interest policy when they join the board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO's compensation is determined and approved by the Board of Directors during the yearly performance review. The Board uses comparability studies to other like non-profits when necessary. When applicable in the fiscal filing period, the same process is utilized for other organization officers or key employees.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, financial statements and Form 990 available to the public upon request. The Form 990 is also available at this website - www.guidestar.org.
